title: Old Fashioned romance.
text:
Seeking old-fashioned romance

I am over 50, young looking, in good physical condition, attractive, intelligent, well-read, intellectual, politically-minded, sensitive, caring, and good-natured; sometimes moody but only in response to life's vagaries. I am a writer and have worked extensively in social services, among many other things. I seek a correspondence with a like-minded gay woman who may be looking for a long-term relationship, however, I want to correspond for as long as it takes for us to get a sense of who the other person is before we meet, keeping in mind that email lends itself to some distortions or mis-perceptions and wanting to keep the correspondence sincere. I am not on any social media and do not own a television. I am allergic to animals although I love them,; drink some but do not do drugs, have a long history with various types of relationships, am both private and gregarious, and am experienced in life and in romance. I have been single since 2011 and am now wanting to meet someone who is quietly caring and able to give of herself when she decides it's time. I prefer that we check each other out before we meet, which is what I mean by old-fashioned; remember when people used to write letters? I am such a letter writer. No photos please. Race/ethnicity unimportant, as long as you consider yourself worldly and educated. Please read this posting carefully before answering. I am serious about my specifications. Look for me, LT

title: Making it Better
text:
If you have questions like 

What is the true role of sex in a relationship?
What's the role of sensuality, intimacy and desire?
What is the meaning of loss of desire and flight into fantasy?
Insecurity - the real enemy?
What is sex really? A physical need? A language for expressing one's emotions? 
What is the role of fantasy and porn? Has the latter rendered emotion and sex incompatible?
Is Monogamy a worthwhile ideal? Am I truly capable of it or does the idea frighten me?
What's the real difference between sex and making love?

American born, European trained clinical/analytical psychologist* specializing in issues of masculine/feminine identity, intimacy/sensuality/trust, sexual dysfunction including impotence/frigidity and compulsive behaviors (e.g.sexual addiction), couples therapy, depression and substance use and abuse. 

Why a European perspective? What's different? Basically, Psychology has two parents: Philosophy in Europe, Education in America. The difference is essential. The former focuses on the "why, believing that no solution can be effective without understanding its' origins. The latter dismisses as relatively unimportant the why", focusing on the what, and targeting a solution through more superficial behavior modification and pharmaceutical support. The implications and consequences are enormous for if one chooses the "shortcut," no meaningful foundation for change has been established. 

Depending on whether or not one wants to chart one's own course into the future or simply adapt to circumstances that are most often beyond one's control, the choice is clear. To weather the inevitable storms, one needs strong roots. Some general questions too often ignored or dismissed as "too difficult" and therefore not worthy of reflection

Offering those ready to face the real questions driving their lives in a direction incompatible with their objectives, an opportunity to explore and discover the deeper "why's" of their behavior and the "how's" of changing it where necessary. 

True to the principal that only what we pay for ourselves is truly worth something ("skin in the game"), no involvement of health insurance will be applicable. However, given the importance of this work, cost will be discussed and adapted to suit the abilities of those consulting.

Reply in confidence for an initial discussion.

Website: www.analyticalpsychologynyc.com
Yelp: analyticalpsychology
tumblr.com/willspoemsforliving


*Due to lack of equivalence, not recognized in New York State

The question seems simple enough right? I think is. Then why does it sometimes seems difficult to find that woman who makes you smile, makes your heart smile? I am looking for a woman who is caring, compassionate, knows what she wants out of life and enjoys what life has to offer. She is funny, serious but not overly, unless the occasion calls for it. text:
Good day and TGIF ladies,

I happened to look out the window and looking out over the city skyline and got lost in thought. The weekend is here and though I enjoy the time I have to myself, having a wonderful woman would make it all the better. I have posted on here in the past with some positive outcomes, but lately it's been somewhat of a bust. I don't think I am asking for too much because it's the simple things that mean more to me. I would like to find a professional woman who also knows how to have fun. I like to sit by the water and listen to the waves roll in while reading a good book, or people watch at the piers. I like walking around the village and the rest of the city. I would love to to find someone who would enjoy sitting together talking about what we want to do the next day or later that evening. Maybe sitting together each reading a book we can't wait to tell the other. I want to find the woman who can find fun almost anywhere. Maybe we are walking in the village and go down side streets and find a unique shop and check it out, maybe go to the piers and people watch, kiss, talk, kiss, lol. I don't know about you but things like this are so magical to me because it's about getting creative together. It's about finding the beauty in our surroundings because we are together. I know I can't be the only one who feels this way. It means starting out with emails, texts, phone conversations and then meeting up. Something happens lately when you suggest meeting up. It's like this vortex sucks them in because they say they want to meet up and you start to make plans and they just disappear. I guess it's better to find out sooner than later that they are not who they say they are. Look, I don't know who will read this, all I know is that I know my special lady is out there and we will find each other. I would just like to find a woman of substance who will make me smile just thinking about her and I will do the same for her. I mean in the end isn't that what we are all searching for? That one woman who gets us. If I have piqued a bit of interest, hit reply and we can take it from there. Tell me a bit about yourself and I will share more about myself. Good Luck ladies. As I sit at my desk trying to make a dent in this paperwork, my thoughts wander to the weekend and wishing I had a beautiful woman to share the weekend with. No, I'm not looking for just a FWB type thing. I am looking for the REAL thing. A woman who is not only beautiful on the outside but inside as well. Nothing is more unattractive than a beautiful woman who views so much in negativity. The woman who makes my heart skip a beat. The woman who brightens my day with a simple text, a call, her smile and laughter. The woman who is just a that, a woman, and not because her age dictates it so, but a woman who knows that life is not a rigid stone but forever changing with what life throws our way. She is intelligent and caring and serious and silly. She enjoys movies, and maybe has a favorite TV show or she likes to binge watch a series. I consider myself a pretty laid back person, I try not to sweat the small stuff because in the grand scheme of things it's not worth it. I would rather spend my time letting the woman who has my heart know how I feel about her. I am not totally femme but also having some chapstick les traits if you will, and though I have mostly dated younger woman (within reason), I'm in my early 40s, I'm not closing myself off to any possibilities (within reason). I like to cook, watch movies, read, but most of all, I like to have good chats, even if it's about the silliest thing. I want to find someone I can be myself around and not have to change who I am as a person and I want her to be able to be exactly who she is. Isn't that what we are all looking for, someone who will love us for us? With that said, I do have preferences as I see most on here do. title: Seeking Friendship First ...hoping to find something more!
text:
Looking for that special person to become friends with and see what happens. Ideally seeking that special person for a LTR. If you are too, read on. 

Please only respond if you live in Nassau County, Queens or NYC. If you live in New Jersey, Connecticut or Mass. Sorry but I'm not looking for a long distance relationship or pen pal. Do Not respond if you are a man (stop trolling the W4W site creep!), a woman looking for a three-way with your husband or boyfriend, Married (to a man or woman), a Bi Woman, or a woman experimenting to see if she is gay. 
Please do not respond if you are not available to date or have issues (i.e. an ex that you aren't over) that prevent you from forming and maintaining a healthy, LTR. I have had LTR's and I am looking for someone that wants to take the time to get to know one another (friendship is an important foundation) and see where it goes.
Please only respond if you are stable (emotionally and financially). 

For those of you interested in becoming friends and possibly more, and are looking for the same thing as I am, please continue reading.

I ran this post before and met a number of very nice women who have become great friends. I also had a few wackos (liars, phonies and mentally imbalanced women) and a few men posing as women. Soooo, I am still looking for that special someone to respond. If you like what I wrote below, and think that you might be the missing puzzle piece in my life and yours, please take a chance and write me back! The worse that can happen is that you make a new friend. 

It's almost a new year and hope springs eternal! I have responded to a number of posts on CL and have been lucky to have met some amazing women. Since ending a long-term relationship, I thought it was time that I got back in the game and put up a Posting. I am serious about meeting someone to become friends with ( go to movies, golf, galleries, shopping, dinners with, etc.) and see where that goes. A LTR is the ultimate goal, but that doesn't form instantly. It takes time and that/s where the friendship plays a big role. If you don't want that, are incapable of this, or are still mourning the end of a relationship, this post isn't for you.

I am an attractive, professional, SWF, 53 (who looks 10 years younger!after we VV we can exchange pics), looking to meet someone, date and see where it goes. I prefer dating professional White femme women, AGES 45-55 (that's my choice, not necessarily yours). 
If you're in your twenties or thirties, this probably won't be a good fit because we probably have very little in common. Yes I said DATE, so if you are looking for NSA or someone to send genital photos to, please move on. I know that there are a lot of wacko's on this site (I've unfortunately corresponded with and met a few) but I know that there are also some wonderful people out there--somewhere out there is a diamond in the rough! 
I am seeking someone who like me is also on a journey, looking for that special relationship to complete an otherwise great life. Someone to share a life with and all that comes with it. Please only respond if you are willing to form a friendship first so we can see if there is anything else there. I don't want to play email tag forever, speak endlessly without meeting, or juggle a busy schedule to set up a date to have it canceled at the last minute or have someone be a rude no show! Please be real and serious about meeting someone. I live on Western Long Island and work in NYC.

If you have not gotten over your ex (and you are just testing the waters, please don't waste my time), if you don't understand that a relationship requires compromise to work and last, have commitment issues, can't reciprocate affection, find normal boring, need psychiatric help (not that there's anything wrong with that, but no thanks! I've been down that road already and honestly, it's too much work and not healthy), have other people in your life that you're involved with (women or men), don't like children (although mine are grown), smoke, are a neurotic vegetarian, don't work or can't tell the truth, please move on.

Because I am an optimist and believe my soulmate is out there looking too, I am ready to find that someone who makes my heart beat faster when we're together (and even when we're not!).

A little about me: As I stated above, I am a SWF, professional, attractive woman looking to date and see where that goes. I am a single mom to 2 teenagers, a 21 year old and a 18 year old. They sometimes live at home on school breaks.
I also have a wonderful rescue dog. If that's a problem, this post isn't for you. I am open to another professional woman who has children (teenagers or older) or who doesn't. You need to understand I have a big heart and I have room for the love of family AND a GF! Hope you do too....

Intelligence and a sense of humor is as important as looks to me, so reading, laughing and being able to maintain a conversation is very important. I have a very dry, sometimes sarcastic sense of humor so if we do date, we will laugh a lot. I think laughter is highly underrated!

I love nice dinners, fine wine, movies, hitting the street fairs and flea markets in the City, Broadway Shows, music/concerts, museums, galleries, any water sports, travel, golf (on a real course, although hitting it past the windmill is fun sometimes too!), working out at the gym a few times a week, a good Happy Hour and HONESTY. I'm tired of unnecessary drama and I have no tolerance for liars.
I would love to find someone who could become a friend and then something more. I'm an attractive athletic femme (5'3",strawberry blond hair, hazel eyes, fit) and I've been told that I am pretty/cute (or so I've been told by men and women!).

Stability, both emotional and financial, is important. We all have issues and baggage if we have lived our lives, just be in control of yours. If you have issues that prevent you from having a normal, healthy relationship, this post is not for you.

If you are interested, I would like to e-mail (briefly) and if we seem to enjoy communicating with each other, have some things in common or just make each other laugh, then a phone call and perhaps meeting up for a drink (alcohol or coffee works), would be great. I don't want to play e-mail tag forever. As to a photo, if we hit it off, we can exchange photos. We will have to voice verify. There are too many guys collecting our photos out there.

Take a chance! What do you have to lose? If nothing else, you could make a new friend and wing-woman to continue our search for that special someone! I hope to hear from you!

title: Seeking Friendship First ...hoping to find something more!
text:
Looking for that special person to become friends with and see what happens. Ideally seeking that special person for a LTR. If you are too, read on. 

Please only respond if you live in Nassau County, Queens or NYC. If you live in New Jersey, Connecticut or Mass. Sorry but I'm not looking for a long distance relationship or pen pal. Do Not respond if you are a man (stop trolling the W4W site creep!), a woman looking for a three-way with your husband or boyfriend, Married (to a man or woman), a Bi Woman, or a woman experimenting to see if she is gay. 
Please do not respond if you are not available to date or have issues (i.e. an ex that you aren't over) that prevent you from forming and maintaining a healthy, LTR. I have had LTR's and I am looking for someone that wants to take the time to get to know one another (friendship is an important foundation) and see where it goes.
Please only respond if you are stable (emotionally and financially). 

For those of you interested in becoming friends and possibly more, and are looking for the same thing as I am, please continue reading.

I ran this post before and met a number of very nice women who have become great friends. I also had a few wackos (liars, phonies and mentally imbalanced women) and a few men posing as women. Soooo, I am still looking for that special someone to respond. If you like what I wrote below, and think that you might be the missing puzzle piece in my life and yours, please take a chance and write me back! The worse that can happen is that you make a new friend. 

It's almost a new year and hope springs eternal! I have responded to a number of posts on CL and have been lucky to have met some amazing women. Since ending a long-term relationship, I thought it was time that I got back in the game and put up a Posting. I am serious about meeting someone to become friends with ( go to movies, golf, galleries, shopping, dinners with, etc.) and see where that goes. A LTR is the ultimate goal, but that doesn't form instantly. It takes time and that/s where the friendship plays a big role. If you don't want that, are incapable of this, or are still mourning the end of a relationship, this post isn't for you.

I am an attractive, professional, SWF, 53 (who looks 10 years younger!after we VV we can exchange pics), looking to meet someone, date and see where it goes. I prefer dating professional White femme women, AGES 45-55 (that's my choice, not necessarily yours). 
If you're in your twenties or thirties, this probably won't be a good fit because we probably have very little in common. Yes I said DATE, so if you are looking for NSA or someone to send genital photos to, please move on. I know that there are a lot of wacko's on this site (I've unfortunately corresponded with and met a few) but I know that there are also some wonderful people out there--somewhere out there is a diamond in the rough! 
I am seeking someone who like me is also on a journey, looking for that special relationship to complete an otherwise great life. Someone to share a life with and all that comes with it. Please only respond if you are willing to form a friendship first so we can see if there is anything else there. I don't want to play email tag forever, speak endlessly without meeting, or juggle a busy schedule to set up a date to have it canceled at the last minute or have someone be a rude no show! Please be real and serious about meeting someone. I live on Western Long Island and work in NYC.

If you have not gotten over your ex (and you are just testing the waters, please don't waste my time), if you don't understand that a relationship requires compromise to work and last, have commitment issues, can't reciprocate affection, find normal boring, need psychiatric help (not that there's anything wrong with that, but no thanks! I've been down that road already and honestly, it's too much work and not healthy), have other people in your life that you're involved with (women or men), don't like children (although mine are grown), smoke, are a neurotic vegetarian, don't work or can't tell the truth, please move on.

Because I am an optimist and believe my soulmate is out there looking too, I am ready to find that someone who makes my heart beat faster when we're together (and even when we're not!).

A little about me: As I stated above, I am a SWF, professional, attractive woman looking to date and see where that goes. I am a single mom to 2 teenagers, a 21 year old and a 18 year old. They sometimes live at home on school breaks.
I also have a wonderful rescue dog. If that's a problem, this post isn't for you. I am open to another professional woman who has children (teenagers or older) or who doesn't. You need to understand I have a big heart and I have room for the love of family AND a GF! Hope you do too....

Intelligence and a sense of humor is as important as looks to me, so reading, laughing and being able to maintain a conversation is very important. I have a very dry, sometimes sarcastic sense of humor so if we do date, we will laugh a lot. I think laughter is highly underrated!

I love nice dinners, fine wine, movies, hitting the street fairs and flea markets in the City, Broadway Shows, music/concerts, museums, galleries, any water sports, travel, golf (on a real course, although hitting it past the windmill is fun sometimes too!), working out at the gym a few times a week, a good Happy Hour and HONESTY. I'm tired of unnecessary drama and I have no tolerance for liars.
I would love to find someone who could become a friend and then something more. I'm an attractive athletic femme (5'3",strawberry blond hair, hazel eyes, fit) and I've been told that I am pretty/cute (or so I've been told by men and women!).

Stability, both emotional and financial, is important. We all have issues and baggage if we have lived our lives, just be in control of yours. If you have issues that prevent you from having a normal, healthy relationship, this post is not for you.

If you are interested, I would like to e-mail (briefly) and if we seem to enjoy communicating with each other, have some things in common or just make each other laugh, then a phone call and perhaps meeting up for a drink (alcohol or coffee works), would be great. I don't want to play e-mail tag forever. As to a photo, if we hit it off, we can exchange photos. We will have to voice verify. There are too many guys collecting our photos out there.

Take a chance! What do you have to lose? If nothing else, you could make a new friend and wing-woman to continue our search for that special someone! I hope to hear from you!
